column1: 414#N-2023-196#Widespread occurence of quaternary alkylammonium disinfectants in soils of Hesse
column2: Germany#Quaternary alkylammonium compounds (QAACs) are cationic organic compounds with amphiphilic properties thatare widely used as surfactants and disinfectants in industry
column3: households and agriculture. Several studies suggest thatQAACs co-select for antibiotic resistant microorganisms and thus may contribute to the spread of antibiotic resistancein the environment. Data on QAAC occurrence in soil are scarce and limited to soils that are prone to direct exposure toQAACs. Therefore
column4: we conducted a comprehensive study on the occurrence of QAACs in soils of Hesse
column7: 115 km2. Sixty-five soil samples that comprised different land uses (arable
column9: forest
column11: agglomeration) were analysed for concentrations ofalkyltrimethylammonium (ATMACs
column15: C8-C18) via HPLC-MS/MS after ultrasonic-assisted ex-traction with acidified acetonitrile. QAACs were detected in 97 % of the soil samples irrespective of land use and areatype.
